definition: old road/familiar way/beaten track/conventional behavior

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
surname Lu

sentences.english: We may just be following Mother Nature's ancient recipe.
sentences.chinese: 我們可能正走在大自然曾走過的老路，步其後塵。

sentences.english: However, the long-expected "new" head acts exactly like the "old" one.
sentences.chinese: 可是他們期待的新村長依然走着上一任村長的老路。

sentences.english: After all, conservatism and the old ways won the battle.
sentences.chinese: 最終還是保守派和老路子贏得了這場戰爭。

sentences.english: These paths all require work and self-discipline.
sentences.chinese: 這些老路都需要努力工作以及自律的精神。

sentences.english: China cannot follow the traditional, Western path of industrialisation.
sentences.chinese: 我們不能走西方國家工業化的老路。

sentences.english: They would rather have familiar experiences than novel ones.
sentences.chinese: 他們寧願走老路而不願體驗新奇的事物。

sentences.english: Even the Chinese are abandoning their methods and trying to be like us.
sentences.chinese: 甚至中國也開始放棄他們的老路子來效仿我們。

sentences.english: It is a great on-road car as well as being able to drive off the beaten track.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個巨大的硫汽車以及能夠驅趕走老路。

sentences.english: There is one alternative, and that is to try and keep everything exactly the way it was, which will not work.
sentences.chinese: 這是一種代替，繼續保持所有的事走老路是行不通的。

sentences.english: We should not retrace the route our forefathers had taken.
sentences.chinese: 我們不應重走我們祖先走過的老路。

sentences.english: Your essence remains the Nazi mantle, you are still wear new shoes to follow the beaten track.
sentences.chinese: 你的骨子裏仍然是納粹的衣鉢，你還在穿新鞋走老路。

sentences.english: He should change his method and not adhere to the old way any longer .
sentences.chinese: 他應該改弦更張，不要再走老路了。

sentences.english: And I have gone beyond and shown a new way.
sentences.chinese: 我突破過去的老路子，展示了一種戰爭的新方法。

sentences.english: The temptation to stick with the old ways will be strong.
sentences.chinese: 但堅持走老路的誘惑會是強烈的。

sentences.english: It's really saddening for her to find out a year later that she's right back where she started.
sentences.chinese: 一年之後她很傷心的發現自己又走回了原來的老路。

definition: see 邪道[xie2 dao4]
the road back to where one came from
method/way/approach
downhill road/(fig.) downhill path
to turn back/to backtrack/(fig.) to revert to the former way of doing things
to repeat/to follow the same road as
disastrous policy
to follow the track of an overturned cart/to repeat a disastrous policy
winding road/roundabout route/detour/(fig.) wrong way (of doing sth)
bon voyage/Godspeed
to stick to one's ways/to cling to one's course
pinyin: yi1 tiao2 dao4 zou3 dao4 hei1

definition: direction/strike (i.e. angle of inclination in geology)/inclination/trend/to move towards/to head for
lit. trailing dust/fig. sb's footsteps/course in life
lit. to set up a separate kitchen (idiom); to start from scratch/back to square one/to start of on a new path
this road is blocked/fig. This method does not work./Doing this is no good.
won't work/will get (you) nowhere
